snippet: A gay man, a former student of Francis, met the pope before the Kentucky clerk did, and the Vatican said the meeting with Ms. Davis was not an endorsement of her views.

byline.contributor: Jim Yardley reported from Vatican City, and Laurie Goodstein from New York.
byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and LAURIE GOODSTEIN

abstract: Vatican spokesman reports that meeting between Pope Francis and Kentucky clerk Kim Davis was not at pontiff's request, but instead arranged by Vatican's Washington ambassador; also provides details of personal meeting between Francis and Yayo Grassi, gay friend of over 50 years, whom he had taught in high school in Argentina; stresses that neither meeting was political in nature.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: A gay man, a former student of Francis, met the pope before the Kentucky clerk did, and the Vatican said the meeting with Ms. Davis was not an endorsement of her views.

headline.print_headline: Before Meeting Clerk, Time With a Gay Friend
headline.main: Before Pope Francis Met Kim Davis, He Met With Gay Ex-Student
